intro: Euphrasia stricta var. tenuis, commonly known as slender trailing eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
